alert.note: Alert for St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 06 at 3:16AM AST until February 06 at 6:00AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 13 feet. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...For the High Surf Advisory, the north facing beaches of St. Thomas and the beaches of Aguada and Rincon. For the High Rip Current Risk, all the beaches of St. Thomas and St. John and the beaches of Aguada and Rincon. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 AM AST Sunday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions, as well as localized beach erosion and minor coastal flooding. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
